title: MacKenzie-Childs: The Cult Favorite Decor Brand Is On Sale for Prime Day
description: One more thing to checker off the list
author: Julia Harrison
excerpt: One more thing to checker off the list, shop Mackenzie Childs markdown—including on their legendary check patterned tableware.

html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

For those of us that care about using our beautiful things instead of staring at them, MacKenzie-Childs robust catalog of hand-painted checker cookware and home decor scratch exactly that itch. Tea kettles, rolling pins, tableware, even shower curtains are all adorned in their ubiquitous courtly check, adding a dose of whimsy to any corner of your home.

First time MacKenzie-Childs shoppers should know this brand merges neo-classical and maximalist styles with a bit of cottagecore for a checkered style so ubiquitous—namely, courtly check—it’s effectively trademarked in the design world. They offer romantic and whimsical decor for just about every room in your home. Whatever it is you need, MacKenzie-Childs can throw (or has thrown) a check on it.

Featured in this article

We’re sleuthing the brand’s markdowns this week as we came across Amazon Prime Day deals include their tumblers, plateware, and teapots. Plus, we’ve scouted other markdowns at retailers like Wayfair and Bloomingdale’s (who are we kidding—we’re looking year-round to find deals on these designer favorites). And if you’re falling in love with something that’s outside your price range, not to fret—the MC annual Barn Sale is running next week from July 17-21 with 60% off thousands of styles, including their best sellers, so keep your eyes peeled for the drop!

MacKenzie-Childs Place Setting (Set of 3)

This three-piece enamelware set includes a dinner plate, salad plate and breakfast bowl to supply a darling dining experience no matter the meal. Made with hand-glazed steel and rimmed in bronzed stainless steel, these are hand-wash only plates—they’re just that fancy.

MacKenzie-Childs Tumbler Glasses (Set of 2)

That maximalism we mentioned? A matching set of tumblers alongside your dinnerware set can help you achieve a fully checkered tablescape worth that covers every last corner with pattern.

MacKenzie-Childs Wine Bottle Cooler

Champagne buckets amplify the fancy factor by a thousand—a cold, cushioned bottle of wine demonstrates the sort of forethought that makes a good host a great host.

MacKenzie-Childs Trinket Box with Knob

This tiny trinket box makes a perfect gift (especially paired with a little something sweet inside).

MacKenzie-Childs Royal Check Rolling Pin

Get back to us on how this holds up as a baker’s tool (though we suspect good things—my MacKenzie-Childs colander certainly holds up under considerable use), but as a decoration element, we consider it nearly perfect. Maybe peaking out of a vintage crock alongside some shaker-style wood utensils?

MacKenzie-Childs Cameo Pedestal Platter

A slight deviation from the royal check, this tiny platter in light blue with white relief epitomizes Romantic Revival. With a little luck (maybe a white lie), your guests will mistake it for a 19th-century heirloom.

MacKenzie-Childs Foundry Wall Mirror

This mirror is on super sale, and a surprising deviation from the brand’s usual whimsy, featuring brutalist influences in iron and brass. The wavy details keep the piece from looking too serious, or heavy.

MacKenzie-Childs Check It Out Watering Can

We meant it when we said they’d thrown a check on everything, watering cans included. But wouldn’t this look so darling tucked between two terracotta pots spilling over with greenery?
